channel.title: Health Care
channel.description: News, Analysis and Opinion from POLITICO

item.title: RFK Jr. ally says GOP risks losing his supporters
item.description: Tony Lyons told POLITICO Republican candidates must demonstrate they support Kennedy’s Make America Healthy Again mission to win midterm votes.

media:content.media:title: Tony Lyons, the health secretary's longtime book publisher, now spearheads Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s political movement.

item.dc:creator: By Cheyenne Haslett

item.title: RFK Jr.’s followers plan to back Trump-endorsed candidates
item.description: A leader of the “Make America Healthy Again” movement said he wants to preserve the Trump-Kennedy coalition that won in 2024.

media:content.media:title: The MAHA movement's commitment indicates that Kennedy and his movement don’t plan to operate as an independent political force. ALEX WROBLEWSKI

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun

item.title: Why Washington’s all-in on smart rings
item.description: Finland’s Oura is telling lawmakers and Trump officials it’s got a solution to systemic health care challenges.

media:content.media:title: Oura spent more than $1 million last year on U.S. lobbying, up from $40,000 in 2024.

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu

item.title: MAHA and Mike Tyson want you to ‘eat real food’ during the Super Bowl
item.description: RFK Jr.’s allies are airing an ad during Sunday’s game touting the new, MAHA-inspired HHS dietary guidelines.

media:content.media:title: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. endorsed the ad, calling it “the most important message in Super Bowl history.”

item.dc:creator: By Aaron Pellish

item.title: TrumpRx debuts with several dozen discounted drugs
item.description: Drug pricing experts have questioned whether the effort would benefit most Americans.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump unveiled the TrumpRx website on Thursday.

item.dc:creator: By David Lim

item.title: NIH looks to turn primate research center into a sanctuary
item.description: The health research agency is offering the Oregon National Primate Research Center federal money to stop testing on primates.

media:content.media:title: NIH Director Jay Bhattacharya confirmed the agency's plans to transition a primate research center into a sanctuary in an interview with POLITICO.

item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: More Americans are picking higher-deductible Obamacare plans, possibly risking their health
item.description: The loss of enhanced subsidies and premium sticker shock are driving the trend, state officials and policy experts say.

media:content.media:title: More Americans in some states bought cheaper 2026 coverage that comes with much higher out-of-pocket costs, a likely symptom of higher premiums.

item.dc:creator: By Robert King

item.title: ‘Anything is possible’: How Jeffrey Epstein received special treatment at one of the country’s elite hospitals
item.description: The convicted sex offender enjoyed unusually close access to Mount Sinai doctors, records show.

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Jade Cuevas/POLITICO (source images via DOJ, Getty Images and iStock)
media:content.media:title: Main.Kaufman.EpsteinSinai.Illustration.jpg

item.dc:creator: By Maya Kaufman

item.title: Democrats just handed RFK Jr. billions more than he asked for. It was a big risk.
item.description: Lawmakers rejected huge health cuts President Donald Trump requested. Kennedy’s diverting the funds to pet projects and red states.

media:content.media:title: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has begun rerouting millions in discretionary funds to studies on autism and cut support for research on transgender people and studies on race and gender disparities.

item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper

item.title: ‘Efficacy will be secondary’: RFK Jr.'s vaccine advisers have a new mission
item.description: The new mandate, the chair of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s panel told POLITICO, is to pay more attention to harms caused by vaccines.

media:content.media:title: Kirk Milhoan, chair of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, wants the independent committee he heads to focus on sussing out vaccine risks this year.

item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: Congress is about to overhaul the drug market. Consumers may never feel it.
item.description: The industry that negotiates drug prices for employers has worked to stay ahead of the game.

media:content.media:title: The pharmaceutical industry has pushed for policies targeting pharmacy benefit managers for years.

item.dc:creator: By David Lim and Amanda Chu
item.dc:contributor: By David Lim and Amanda Chu

item.title: Cassidy took on RFK Jr. over vaccines. Now Kennedy's followers are out to defeat him.
item.description: Devotees of the health secretary’s Make America Healthy Again movement say they oppose the Louisiana senator’s reelection.

media:content.media:title: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.) is seen at the U.S. Capitol, on Dec. 18, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein and Simon J. Levien
item.dc:contributor: By Alice Miranda Ollstein and Simon J. Levien

item.title: RFK Jr. is now a wellness guru for Republicans in Washington
item.description: Conservatives in the capital are taking up the health secretary’s advice, eating their vegetables and eschewing pharmaceuticals.

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Olga Khaletskaya for POLITICO
media:content.media:title: Main.Chu.MAHAinDC.Illustration

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu

item.title: A meeting with RFK Jr. set off recriminations inside doctors’ lobbying arm
item.description: Leaders of the American Medical Association want a seat at the health secretary’s table. Some AMA members would prefer to ostracize him.

media:content.media:title: Kennedy was gratified AMA President Bobby Mukkamala attended his dietary guidelines rollout.

item.dc:creator: By Simon J. Levien

item.title: Trump proposal signals Medicare austerity
item.description: Health insurers who thought Trump would rescue their Medicare businesses got a rude awakening Monday.

media:content.media:title: The Trump administration is proposing a payment increase of less than 1 percent, or $700 million, for Medicare Advantage plans in 2027.

item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper

item.title: The psychedelic medicine revolution that wasn’t
item.description: Believers in the healing potential of the mind-altering drugs thought RFK Jr. was the answer to their prayers. They’re still waiting.

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Jade Cuevas/POLITICO (source images via Getty Images and iStock)
media:content.media:title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. vowed to Congress last June to green-light clinical psychedelic therapy “within 12 months.”

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu

item.title: Trump asks federal court to hit pause on abortion pill case, citing ongoing study
item.description: The administration argues the lawsuit may be “unnecessary” since the FDA may impose the restrictions Louisiana wants of its own volition.

media:content.media:title: Louisiana is suing the Trump administration, seeking restrictions on the abortion pill mifepristone. (Photo by DREW ANGERER/AFP via Getty Images)

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein

item.title: Vance announces aid restrictions for groups that promote diversity, transgender policies abroad
item.description: The move expands a longstanding Republican policy that restricted U.S. funding for organizations working on or promoting abortion overseas.

media:content.media:title: At the March for Life in Washington on Friday, Vice President JD Vance reassured anti-abortion activists that President Donald Trump is still committed to their cause.

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun

item.title: Abortion opponents demand more as Trump targets Planned Parenthood, foreign aid and fetal tissue research
item.description: The administration moves, timed around the annual March for Life, may not win back frustrated groups.

media:content.media:credit: Dominic Gwinn/Middle East Images/AFP via Getty Images
media:content.media:title: Supporters of the religious right march through Washington, D.C., to protest abortion during the 2025 March for Life.

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein

item.title: A US return to the World Health Organization could hinge on whether Trump approves of its next leader
item.description: The disease-fighting alliance will select a new leader next year who could make the case for reuniting.

media:content.media:title: WHO member countries will elect a new director-general next year. Fabrice COFFRINI

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun

item.title: RFK Jr. is bringing the GOP and the trial bar together
item.description: Plaintiffs’ lawyers, long Republican adversaries, see a lot to like in Kennedy’s assault on food and pharma.

media:content.media:title: Trial lawyers said Kennedy’s sweeping agenda targeting food, chemical and pharmaceutical companies is creating a tailwind for the tort system to take on corporate power.

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu

item.title: This pharmaceutical executive has Trump's ear
item.description: David Ricks, CEO of the Indiana drugmaker, has cut deals with the president to slash prices and build American. Trump has showered him with praise.

media:content.media:title: Eli Lilly maintains codifying President Donald Trump's most-favored-nation deals in law is not needed.

item.dc:creator: By David Lim

item.title: Trump jettisons the GOP’s corporate allies in health care plan
item.description: The president pointed the finger at insurers and pharma in calling for price cuts to help stressed voters.

media:content.media:title: Trump's plan aims to unite a party that's long struggled to settle on a health care message.

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu, David Lim, Robert King and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Amanda Chu, David Lim, Robert King and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Democrats make pitch to keep no-premium Obamacare plans
item.description: While Republicans believe the plans encourage fraud, Democrats worry that raising premiums will prompt lower-income enrollees to drop coverage.

media:content.media:title: Sen. Raphael Warnock, D-Ga., has been pushing his GOP colleagues to keep zero-dollar premium plans in bipartisan talks to extend enhanced Obamacare subsidies.

item.dc:creator: By Robert King

item.title: Abortion opponents threaten to withhold midterm support amid rift with Trump
item.description: Amid concerns about the president's actions, abortion opponents are threatening to redirect or withhold campaign spending and withdraw their volunteer armies in the midterms.

media:content.media:title: Pro-life demonstrators listen to former President Donald Trump as he speaks at the 47th annual "March for Life" in Washington, DC, on January 24, 2020.

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein and Megan Messerly
item.dc:contributor: By Alice Miranda Ollstein and Megan Messerly

item.title: HHS terminates, then reinstates, thousands of grants for substance use, mental health
item.description: The Department of Health and Human Services told grantees their projects were no longer aligned with agency priorities, then backtracked under pressure.

media:content.media:title: The Trump administration began slashing thousands of grants dedicated to mental health treatment and substance abuse recovery Tuesday.

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun and Amanda Friedman
item.dc:contributor: By Carmen Paun and Amanda Friedman

item.title: National health spending soared for 2nd consecutive year in 2024
item.description: The 7.2 percent increase comes as Americans continue to seek out medical care at high levels.

media:content.media:title: Americans have continued to seek out high levels of medical care — including hospital, doctor and prescription drug services — in the aftermath of the Covid pandemic.

item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper

item.title: Lawsuit dismissed after Trump admin quietly restored tens of millions to Planned Parenthood
item.description: Progressive groups dropped their case against HHS over the withheld family planning funds, but other challenges continue.

media:content.media:title: Though lawsuits continue about a far bigger cut to Planned Parenthood's federal Medicaid funds, the restoration of Title X funding will help many clinics keep their doors open. (Photo by Kayla Bartkowski/Getty Images)

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein

item.title: RFK Jr.’s theories about vaccines are about to be tested
item.description: American kids are no longer routinely being recommended shots against hepatitis A, meningitis, rotavirus and the flu.

media:content.media:title: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s move to downgrade several childhood vaccine recommendations will likely have consequences, public health experts say.

item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: Parents on RFK Jr.’s advice on sweets: ‘Completely unrealistic’
item.description: The health secretary’s new dietary guidelines tell parents to cut the added sugar until their kids turn 11.

media:content.media:title: The new guidelines are the government’s declaration of war on added sugar, Kennedy said this week. Brandon Bell

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun and Grace Yarrow
item.dc:contributor: By Carmen Paun and Grace Yarrow
